definitions: person who climbs mountains as a sport or recreation
examples: The experienced mountaineer reached the summit at dawn
Several mountaineers attempted the challenging north face route

definitions: sport or activity of climbing mountains using special equipment
examples: Mountaineering requires physical fitness and technical skills
She took up mountaineering after joining the alpine club

definitions: sloping side or face of a mountain below the summit
examples: The village nestled on the sunny mountainside overlooking the valley
Wildflowers covered the mountainside in brilliant spring colors

definitions: frame or support structure for holding equipment or objects
process of gradually increasing in amount or intensity over time
examples: The telescope requires a sturdy mounting for stable viewing
Check the mounting brackets before installing the equipment
His mounting frustration was evident in his voice
The mounting pressure forced them to make a decision

definitions: person who attends a funeral or expresses grief for someone who died
examples: Mourners gathered at the cemetery to pay their respects
The church was filled with mourners during the memorial service

definitions: expression of deep sorrow for someone who has died, often shown through behavior or dress
examples: The family observed a week of mourning after the loss
She wore black clothing as a sign of mourning

definitions: mechanical device designed to catch or kill mice in homes
examples: We set a mousetrap in the pantry to catch the pest
The traditional mousetrap uses cheese as bait

definitions: light creamy dessert made with whipped eggs or cream
foamy hair product used for styling and adding volume
examples: The chocolate mousse was served in elegant glass cups
We ordered raspberry mousse for dessert at the restaurant
Apply mousse to damp hair before blow drying
The styling mousse helps control frizz and add shine

definitions: strip of hair growing on upper lip above the mouth
examples: He trimmed his moustache carefully every morning before work
The actor grew a thick moustache for his new role

definitions: part of musical instrument or device placed in the mouth
person who speaks on behalf of another person or group
examples: The trumpet mouthpiece needs regular cleaning for hygiene
She replaced the mouthpiece on her clarinet before practice
The lawyer acted as a mouthpiece for the corporation
He became the unofficial mouthpiece for the protest movement

definitions: object or piece of furniture that can be moved from place to place
examples: The office uses movable partitions to create flexible spaces
All movables were removed before the building renovation

definitions: person whose job is moving furniture and belongings
person who makes things happen or influences important decisions
examples: The movers arrived early to pack our household goods
We hired professional movers for our cross country relocation
She's a real mover in the tech industry
The company's movers and shakers met for strategic planning

definitions: machine with rotating blades for cutting grass on lawns
examples: The lawn mower needs sharpening before the growing season
He pushed the mower across the backyard every Saturday

definitions: mild white Italian cheese traditionally made from buffalo milk
examples: Fresh mozzarella pairs perfectly with tomatoes and basil
The pizza was topped with melted mozzarella and pepperoni

definitions: abbreviation for miles per hour used to measure speed
examples: The speed limit on this highway is 65 mph
The storm winds reached speeds of 120 mph

definitions: wet sticky mixture of dirt and filth that is unpleasant
examples: His boots were covered in muck from the barnyard
The heavy rain turned the field into thick muck

definitions: state of confusion or disorder where things are mixed up
examples: The paperwork was in a complete muddle after the move
Their travel plans ended up in a muddle

definitions: rapid movement of large amount of mud down a hillside
examples: Heavy rains triggered a mudslide that blocked the highway
The mudslide destroyed several homes in its path

definitions: tube of fur or fabric for keeping hands warm in cold weather
examples: She carried a fur muff to keep her hands warm
The vintage muff matched her winter coat perfectly

definitions: individual sized quick bread often sweet and baked in cup shape
examples: She grabbed a blueberry muffin for breakfast
The bakery sells fresh muffins every morning

definitions: device on vehicle exhaust system that reduces engine noise
thick scarf worn around neck for warmth in cold weather
examples: The car needs a new muffler to reduce the noise
A damaged muffler can affect engine performance
She wrapped a wool muffler around her neck
His grandmother knitted him a warm muffler for winter

definitions: large cup with handle typically used for hot drinks
informal term for a person's face or facial expression
examples: She sipped coffee from her favorite ceramic mug
The mug holds about twelve ounces of liquid
His mug appeared on wanted posters across town
The photographer captured every mug in the crowd

definitions: person who attacks and robs someone in a public place
examples: The mugger was caught by police near the park
She gave a description of the mugger to detectives

definitions: violent crime of attacking and robbing someone in public
examples: The mugging occurred in broad daylight downtown
Police increased patrols after several muggings

definitions: tree that produces sweet dark purple berries in clusters
dark reddish purple color resembling the fruit of mulberry tree
examples: The mulberry tree attracts birds when fruit ripens
We made jam from mulberries picked in the garden
She chose a mulberry dress for the evening event
The sunset turned the sky a beautiful mulberry shade

definitions: material spread around plants to retain moisture and prevent weeds
examples: Spread mulch around the roses to conserve water
Wood chip mulch helps regulate soil temperature

definitions: offspring of male donkey and female horse used for carrying loads
shoe or slipper with no back strap leaving heel exposed
examples: The mule carried supplies up the mountain trail
Mules are known for their strength and endurance
She slipped on leather mules for the casual dinner
The designer mules featured decorative buckles

definitions: edible fish found in coastal waters around the world
hairstyle short at front and sides but long at back
examples: Fresh mullet is popular in Mediterranean cuisine
The fisherman caught several mullet near the pier
His mullet hairstyle was popular in the eighties
The rock star sported a classic mullet look

definitions: presence and acceptance of multiple cultural traditions within a society or institution
examples: The school promotes multiculturalism through diverse programming
Multiculturalism enriches our community with different perspectives

definitions: use of several different types of media such as text, audio, and video combined together
examples: The multimedia presentation included videos and interactive graphics
Students created multimedia projects using various digital tools

definitions: large building containing several movie theaters showing different films simultaneously
examples: The new multiplex downtown has twelve screens
We went to the multiplex to see the latest releases

definitions: mathematical process of adding a number to itself a specified number of times
examples: Children learn multiplication tables in elementary school
The multiplication of large numbers requires careful calculation

definitions: state of being multiple or having great variety and diversity
examples: The multiplicity of options made the decision difficult
We appreciate the multiplicity of voices in our organization

definitions: factor by which something is increased or amplified
number by which another number is multiplied in mathematics
examples: Tourism acts as an economic multiplier for the region
The multiplier effect created more jobs than expected
In the equation, seven is the multiplier
Use the multiplier to calculate the final result

definitions: extremely large number of people or things grouped together
examples: A multitude of stars filled the clear night sky
The festival attracted a multitude of visitors

definitions: informal British word for mother used especially by children
shortened form of chrysanthemum, a fall flowering plant
examples: My mum makes the best Sunday roast dinner
He called his mum to wish her happy birthday
The garden mums bloomed in autumn colors
She planted yellow mums along the walkway

definitions: process of preserving dead body by drying to prevent decay, especially in ancient Egypt
examples: Mummification was an important ritual in ancient Egyptian culture
The museum exhibit explained the mummification process

definitions: dead body preserved by wrapping in cloth after special treatment
child's word for mother, especially in British English
examples: The ancient mummy was discovered in a hidden tomb
Egyptian mummies are displayed in many museums worldwide
My mummy reads me bedtime stories every night
The toddler ran to mummy when he fell

definitions: contagious viral disease causing swelling of salivary glands near ears
examples: The child stayed home from school with the mumps
Vaccination has greatly reduced cases of mumps

definitions: city or town with its own local government and defined boundaries
examples: The municipality voted to increase funding for parks
Each municipality sets its own local tax rates

definitions: military weapons, ammunition, and equipment used in warfare
examples: The factory produced munitions during the war
Soldiers loaded munitions onto transport vehicles

definitions: large painting or artwork applied directly to a wall or ceiling
examples: The artist painted a colorful mural on the building
The mural depicts scenes from local history

definitions: artist who specializes in creating large paintings on walls
examples: The muralist spent months completing the courthouse artwork
Famous muralists often work on public art projects

definitions: low continuous sound like quiet talking or gentle flowing water
examples: A murmur of conversation filled the waiting room
The murmur of the stream was soothing

definitions: arrangement and development of muscles in a body or body part
examples: The athlete's musculature showed years of dedicated training
Anatomists study the musculature of different species

definitions: person or thing that inspires an artist, writer, or musician to create
examples: The poet found his muse in nature's beauty
She became the artist's muse for many paintings

definitions: soft, wet, pulpy mass often from cooked or crushed food
examples: The overcooked vegetables turned into unappetizing mush
He mashed the bananas into mush for the baby

definitions: fungus with dome shaped cap on a stalk, some edible and others poisonous
examples: She added sliced mushrooms to the pasta sauce
Wild mushrooms grew in the damp forest floor

definitions: quality of being musical or having natural ability to appreciate and produce music
examples: The dancer moved with remarkable musicality and rhythm
Her musicality was evident in every performance
